summary: This is a sealed application and order from the U.S. District Court for the Southern District of New York, authorizing the FBI to install a pen register and trap-and-trace device on a telephone line subscribed to 'G Max' for 60 days. The surveillance is part of an ongoing criminal investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell and others for potential violations of federal sex trafficking and conspiracy statutes.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified as the primary target, along with others, of an FBI investigation for possible violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 1591 (sex trafficking), 371 (conspiracy), 2423(a) (transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity), and 2422 (coercion and enticement).

persons.name: James L. Cott
persons.context: Signed the court order authorizing the use of the pen register and trap-and-trace device on the target phone line.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: The Assistant U.S. Attorney filing the application states they work in Berman's office, identifying him as the head of the prosecuting office.

events.title: Court authorizes surveillance of 'G Max' phone
events.description: A U.S. Magistrate Judge signs an order authorizing the FBI to install a pen register and trap-and-trace device on a telephone line subscribed to 'G Max' for 60 days to aid in the investigation of Ghislaine Maxwell.

keyFacts: In June 2020, the U.S. government obtained a sealed court order to conduct electronic surveillance (pen register/trap-and-trace) on a phone line subscribed under the name 'G Max', which is strongly implied to belong to Ghislaine Maxwell.

The surveillance was authorized as part of an active FBI investigation into Maxwell and others for potential violations of federal sex trafficking, conspiracy, and transportation statutes (18 U.S.C. §§ 1591, 371, 2423(a), 2422).
The order specifically authorized the collection of metadata (phone numbers, IP addresses, communication ports, date, time, duration) but not the contents of any communications.
The application and order were filed under seal to prevent disclosure of the investigation to the target subjects.
